data.title: Very nice hotel at a reasonable price
data.text: We really liked this hotel. It was more attractive than we had expected, and the room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was quite good - I had an omelette with veggies that was really tasty. It's convenient to everything (though not much in Casper is that far away). With the price this competitive, we would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, Front Office Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
My team and I would like to thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review about our hotel. Thank you for noting our convenient location, just out of downtown Casper. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip.

"Making Friends One Guest at a Time"
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love the staff
data.text: Could not ask for better staff members, they always go above and beyond to ensure their customers are happy.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking time to share this great feedback. Our staff takes great pride when they hear comments like yours. We hope to see you again soon on your next trip to the southern part of the state!
Yours in Hospitality,
Days Inn Casper

"Making Friends One Guest at a Time"
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great place to stay
data.text:
Upon arriving, check in went smooth, lobby smelled clean and looked newer.  Our room was spacious, we had 2 beds, 3 people, and paid $78 plus tax on a Saturday, in October, 2016.  
It was quiet, everything worked good in the room and had a fridge.  
Breakfast was great, everything you need.  Even biscuits and gravy.
We for sure would come back to this hotel.    
If you walk left at the starbucks, it doesn't take long to walk to downtown to many restaurants. 
We choose Racca's Pizzeria Napoletana, on Ash st.  A 15 min walk.  Was nice to walk after a long trip.  This place has variety items on the menu, but more Italian,    beer on tap, is loud with the talking, which made it a fun place.  It is a bit pricy, but worth it.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review about our hotel! We want to make every aspect of your stay a Perfect 10 for you. We love hearing that your stay has been comfortable and the staff helpful.
Thank you for sharing your review.
We look forward to seeing you again soon!
Yours in Hospitality,
Days Inn Casper

"Making Friends One Guest at a Time.."
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Place to Relax
data.text: A nice quiet, relaxful place to stay.  They don't have kitchenettes but they serve a fantastic hot buffet.  Just about any breakfast food you can think of.  Free!  A comfortable bed & recliner (chair with ottoman). Nice people at the desk and a free newspaper at the front door every morning.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for coming back to the Days Inn in Casper! And for taking time to share this great feedback. We love to hear good things about our breakfast and complimentary items. Our goal is to create a memorable guest experience each and every time and we are happy to see that we succeeded. 
"Making Friends One Guest at a Time.."
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Okay Stay
data.text: Typical Days Inn.  The motel is in a U shape and getting to the rooms can be cumbersome.  We were directed to parking at a location that was further from our room than necessary.  This stay was routine, nothing spectacular, nor negative.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest , Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay with us. We value your feedback as we are always looking for ways to improve quality. If you happen to be back in town we would love to WOW you with an exceptional experience. Feel free to give us a call 307-234-1159
"Making Friends One Guest At A Time"

data.title: No TV No Internet
data.text: Stayed at this location for two days. No Internet and no TV.  Two things I would expect to have at the Wyndham Hotel. Maybe a discount too.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review. I would truly appreciate the opportunity to visit with you more about your recent stay and make the experience right with you. Please contact me 307-253-1159, so I may get a few more details and research the TV and Internet. 

"Making Friends One Guest At a Time"

Michelle Newberry
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dog Friendly
data.text: We traveled this trip with a small, well-trained dog, one we would NEVER leave alone in a room, although we probably could.  The Days Inn in Cheyenne accepts dogs for a $15 surcharge.  We were happy to pay it, and Michelle at the front desk was very nice.  But I was surprised to find that despite the surcharge, we were given a room with (a) spots on the carpet, (b) a loose, rattling panel on the AC unit, (c) scratches on the TOP of the bureau, and (d) a small round dent in the entry door.  In short, we paid extra money for a crappy room.  Doesn't seem right. We stayed at Super 8 in Cedar City Utah the following night.  For the same $15 surcharge THIS room was beautiful; clean and well-maintained.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We always appreciate our guest feedback and especially comments that will make us a better hotel. As the manager of this facility I would like to apologize for the housekeeping portion of this, And will be sure to get with maintenance and make sure that all pet rooms are getting maintained correctly. If you happen to be passing through Casper any time soon feel free to give us a call, so we can WOW you with an exceptional experience!
"Making friends one guest at a time"
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A surprise--will stay there again
data.text: I find hotels hit or miss in Casper. This place was a surprise with a fix-it-yourself breakfast (make your own waffles, eggs, biscuits and gravy) a great rate and super decent rooms. It's right next to a business with trucks during the day and it's on a major road but all that said it was a happy find. You are a 10 minute walk to downtown. Really friendly staff. A great deal.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest , Thank you for taking the time to leave such a nice review about your recent stay with us. We love hearing that our staff was friendly and helpful. We appreciate your business, and we hope to see you again very soon!

"Making Friends One Guest At A Time..."
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A few problems...but taken care of immediately!
data.text: Very friendly gals at the front desk, no problems checking in.  I'm the type that always checks sheets etc. before even unpacking essentials....not happy when I found what appeared to be dog hair on the top and bottom sheets-I notified front desk who came right in with new sheets and blanket.  Looks like things might have been washed with something that had dog hair on it...rest of the stay was comfortable and breakfast was good.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are happy to read, that even though you had a not so pleasant thing happen, we made your experience better. As the Manager of this facility I would like to apologize for the housekeeping portion of this review. I have gotten with our housekeeping/ laundry team to insure that all pet room sheets are washed separate from the rest, as per our policy. Our goal is to be a great hotel our guests love and it is always nice knowing when we have accomplished this! Thank you for taking the time out of your day to write a review about your stay.  We hope to see you again on your next trip to Casper!

"Making friends one guest at a time"
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Value.
data.text:
We had a reservation at a nearby Motel but were told our room wasn't ready and "might" be ready in an hour or two. We went down the street to the Days Inn and got a better room for $30 less.

Fast and friendly check in, quiet comfortable room and great location from the Interstate.

We will definitely stay there on our next trip through that area.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We love to read about our team being friendly, helpful & accommodating. Our goal is to create a memorable guest experience each and every time and we are happy to hear that we have accomplished this! My staff and I would like to thank you for taking the time out of your day to write such a nice review about our hotel. We appreciate your business, and we hope to see you again very soon!

"..Until our paths meet again.."
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good price for a short stay
data.text: Hotel sits back a bit from highway, and parking lot is rough and needs resurfacing. Had to walk through potholes and puddles past a few rough characters smoking outside the side entrance door. Once inside, the smell of pet urine was overwhelming. This hotel allows pets, and there must have been many "accidents" in the hallway. Once inside our room, things were fine, and no noticeable smell. Continental breakfast was nice, but in a small corner. Staff is friendly, and most patrons are decent, but majority were truckers or contractors passing through. Not much of a family feel. Overall, our stay was okay, and was adequate for one night.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for letting us know how your recent stay was. We truly appreciate your feedback. I apologize for the problems you encountered with the park lot and hallways. The feedback we receive from our guests, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve. 
"Making Friends One Guest At a Time"

Until our paths meet again..

Michelle Newberry
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Days Inn
data.text: I recently stayed at the Days Inn and it was not as clean as I would have hoped.  I found human hair in the shower and bedding that was not mine.  The carpets are seriously stained.  The furniture was not clean and I found myself taking clorox wipes to the items I used because they had previous sticky stuff on them including the office chair.  After disinfecting all of the items I touched daily I felt more comfortable with the room.  I found what looked to be blood stains or juice stains at the bottom of the window curtains.  However, the price was great for me as I had an extended stay and the total dollar amount was of interest to me.  I did feel very safe at the hotel.  The staff was extremely nice and very helpful.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I would like to personally apologize for the problems you had at our hotel. If you could please give me a call at your earliest convenience, so we can make sure we make things right with your stay. The phone number is 307.234.1159.

"Making Friends One Guest At a Time"

Until our paths meet again..

Michelle Newberry
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great stop off point
data.text: This Days Inn is an easy stopping point in Casper. It is right off the freeway(I-25) and is near many things in Casper City center. I have stayed here a few times, and look forward to going back. The rooms are comfortable. The front desk help are very friendly.

data.title: Pleasant, will stay here again
data.text: Inexpensive. Quiet room on second floor.  Reasonably clean, but vacuuming could be better in corners of room.  AC vibrated loudly when condenser was running; at checkout, desk attendant took a note and said they'd fix it.  Pillows a bit hard.  Breakfast was good quality.  We would have stayed again on return leg of our trip, but timing didn't allow it.  Good accommodations for cost-conscious travelers.

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for letting us know how your recent stay was. We truly appreciate your feedback. I apologize for the problems you encountered with your room. I work closely with our staff to remedy, any and all problems in the rooms. Thank you for recommendation, to other travelers. 

"Making Friends One Guest At a Time"

Until our paths meet again..

Michelle Newberry
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Small Ray of Hope!
data.text:
Here we were just south of Yellowstone Park having escaped wintry weather in mid-September.  We needed a place to stay and catch our breath!  The Casper Wyoming Days Inn fit the bill!  Frank was helpful and understanding when I called to book the room.  It was very late at night when we arrived and there he was to help us.
We had a quiet, restful night and breakfast before we were on our way east.
Thank you Days Inn in Caster, Wyoming!

owner_response.author: Michelle N, General Manager at Days Inn Casper, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We love hearing that your stays have been comfortable and the staff (Frank) helpful. Thank you for sharing your review. Our goal is to create a memorable guest experience each and every time and we are happy to see that we succeeded. 

"Making Friends One Guest At a Time"

Until our paths meet again..

Michelle Newberry
owner_response.title: Owner Response
